title: Half physical damage
data:
**Half physical damage** is an [extrinsic](/wiki/Extrinsic "Extrinsic") property in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* which halves many types of physical [damage](/wiki/Damage "Damage"). This property is conferred by carrying [The Master Key of Thievery](/wiki/The_Master_Key_of_Thievery "The Master Key of Thievery") or [The Orb of Fate](/wiki/The_Orb_of_Fate "The Orb of Fate").

A more limited form of this effect is bestowed upon [priests](/wiki/Priest "Priest") wearing [the Mitre of Holiness](/wiki/The_Mitre_of_Holiness "The Mitre of Holiness"), which halves attack damage from [major demons](/wiki/Major_demons "Major demons"), [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead"), and [shapeshifted](/wiki/Shapeshifter "Shapeshifter") [vampires](/wiki/Vampire_\(monster_class\) "Vampire (monster class)").

Carrying a second half physical damage artifact does not further reduce damage taken.

Half physical damage applies after the damage reduction from [armor class](/wiki/Armor_class "Armor class"), if any.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)
- [2 History](#History)
- [3 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
- [4 See also](#See_also)
- [5 References](#References)

## Description

Half physical damage protects against:

- ordinary physical damage from a monster attack[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)
- the [geyser](/wiki/Geyser "Geyser") [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell")[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)
- explosion of a [gas spore](/wiki/Gas_spore "Gas spore")[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)
- fall of a [piercer](/wiki/Piercer "Piercer")[\[9\]](#cite_note-9)
- ordinary physical damage from a [falling rock trap](/wiki/Falling_rock_trap "Falling rock trap"), [bear trap](/wiki/Bear_trap "Bear trap"), [rust trap](/wiki/Rust_trap "Rust trap") (if you are polymorphed into an [iron golem](/wiki/Iron_golem "Iron golem")), [pit](/wiki/Pit "Pit"), [spiked pit](/wiki/Spiked_pit "Spiked pit"), or [land mine](/wiki/Land_mine "Land mine")[\[10\]](#cite_note-10)[\[11\]](#cite_note-11)
- exploding a [chest](/wiki/Chest "Chest")[\[12\]](#cite_note-12)
- exploding a [door](/wiki/Door "Door") or a [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin")[\[13\]](#cite_note-13)
- sitting on an iron spike in a [spiked pit](/wiki/Spiked_pit "Spiked pit") *(not exactly halved)*[\[14\]](#cite_note-14)
- rust damage from exposure to water (if you are polymorphed into an [iron golem](/wiki/Iron_golem "Iron golem"))[\[15\]](#cite_note-15)
- crashing to the floor via [levitation](/wiki/Levitation "Levitation") over a [sink](/wiki/Sink "Sink")[\[16\]](#cite_note-16)
- hit point loss from being polyformed into an [eel](/wiki/Eel "Eel") out of water[\[17\]](#cite_note-17)
- maximum energy drain from a [foocubus](/wiki/Foocubus "Foocubus") encounter[\[18\]](#cite_note-18)
- exhaustion from a [foocubus](/wiki/Foocubus "Foocubus") encounter[\[19\]](#cite_note-19)
- [hurtling](/wiki/Hurtling "Hurtling") into an obstacle[\[20\]](#cite_note-20)
- damage from tossing an object upwards[\[21\]](#cite_note-21)[\[22\]](#cite_note-22)
- damage from a returning thrown weapon that you fail to catch[\[23\]](#cite_note-23)
- damage from a potion of [holy water](/wiki/Holy_water "Holy water")[\[24\]](#cite_note-24) or [unholy water](/wiki/Unholy_water "Unholy water")[\[25\]](#cite_note-25)
- quaffing a cursed [potion of levitation](/wiki/Potion_of_levitation "Potion of levitation") on a level where you cannot rise[\[26\]](#cite_note-26)
- damage from a [potion of acid](/wiki/Potion_of_acid "Potion of acid")[\[27\]](#cite_note-27)[\[28\]](#cite_note-28)
- physical damage from a thrown or wielded potion bottle[\[29\]](#cite_note-29)
- damage from an attached [heavy iron ball](/wiki/Heavy_iron_ball "Heavy iron ball")[\[30\]](#cite_note-30)[\[31\]](#cite_note-31)[\[32\]](#cite_note-32)
- an exploding [wand](/wiki/Wand "Wand")[\[33\]](#cite_note-33)
- damage from zapping yourself with a wand[\[34\]](#cite_note-34)
- hitting yourself with a [bullwhip](/wiki/Bullwhip "Bullwhip")[\[35\]](#cite_note-35)
- hitting yourself with a [grappling hook](/wiki/Grappling_hook "Grappling hook")[\[36\]](#cite_note-36)
- breaking a [wand](/wiki/Wand "Wand")[\[37\]](#cite_note-37)
- light damage to yourself polymorphed into a [gremlin](/wiki/Gremlin "Gremlin")[\[38\]](#cite_note-38)
- damage from a falling [rock](/wiki/Rock "Rock") or [boulder](/wiki/Boulder "Boulder") from other causes[\[39\]](#cite_note-39)[\[40\]](#cite_note-40)[\[41\]](#cite_note-41)
- hitting your own foot with an axe while trying to free yourself from a bear trap[\[42\]](#cite_note-42)
- deliberately hitting yourself with a pick-axe[\[43\]](#cite_note-43)
- hitting a statue or a boulder with an axe (not a pick-axe)[\[44\]](#cite_note-44)
- splashes from [lava](/wiki/Lava "Lava")[\[45\]](#cite_note-45)
- squished under a [boulder](/wiki/Boulder "Boulder")[\[46\]](#cite_note-46)
- contusion from squeezing into a [hole](/wiki/Hole "Hole") while polymorphed into a huge monster[\[47\]](#cite_note-47)
- falling down stairs or a ladder[\[48\]](#cite_note-48)
- charging a [ring](/wiki/Ring "Ring") or [wand](/wiki/Wand "Wand") until it explodes[\[49\]](#cite_note-49)[\[50\]](#cite_note-50)
- blasted by a silver artifact while polymorphed into a silver hater (silver damage only)[\[51\]](#cite_note-51)
- exploding [spellbook](/wiki/Spellbook "Spellbook")[\[52\]](#cite_note-52)
- casting a spell of force bolt at yourself[\[53\]](#cite_note-53)
- falling off a [steed](/wiki/Steed "Steed")[\[54\]](#cite_note-54)[\[55\]](#cite_note-55)
- exploding [crystal ball](/wiki/Crystal_ball "Crystal ball")[\[56\]](#cite_note-56)
- [poison cloud](/wiki/Poison_cloud "Poison cloud")[\[57\]](#cite_note-57)
- [kicking](/wiki/Kick "Kick") certain things[\[58\]](#cite_note-58)
- looting a [bag of tricks](/wiki/Bag_of_tricks "Bag of tricks")[\[59\]](#cite_note-59)

Half physical damage does not protect against:[\[60\]](#cite_note-60)

- damage covered by a [resistance](/wiki/Resistance "Resistance"), including [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance"), [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance"), [shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance"), [acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance"), and [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance")
  - despite this principle, damage from a [potion of acid](/wiki/Potion_of_acid "Potion of acid") is covered
- damage that leaves no mark, including [poison](/wiki/Poison "Poison") and [sickness](/wiki/Sickness "Sickness")
- the final stage of total [digestion](/wiki/Digestion "Digestion")[\[61\]](#cite_note-61)
- damage from most [passive](/wiki/Passive "Passive") attacks
- some damage from [lava](/wiki/Lava "Lava")
- damage from magical explosions such as an [alchemic blast](/wiki/Alchemic_blast "Alchemic blast") or [bag of holding](/wiki/Bag_of_holding "Bag of holding")
- damage from divine sources such as being turned
- damage from an [arrow trap](/wiki/Arrow_trap "Arrow trap")[\[62\]](#cite_note-62) or [dart trap](/wiki/Dart_trap "Dart trap")[\[63\]](#cite_note-63)
- an [antimagic trap](/wiki/Antimagic_trap "Antimagic trap") does 1d4 *more* damage to a hero with half physical damage[\[64\]](#cite_note-64)

## History

In NetHack 3.4.3 and earlier versions, half physical damage did not protect against many of the uncommon damage effects listed above.

## SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") adds two more items which give this very useful property - [The Hand of Vecna](/wiki/The_Hand_of_Vecna_\(SLASH%27EM\) "The Hand of Vecna (SLASH'EM)") and [Gauntlets of Defense](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_Defense "Gauntlets of Defense"). These make [wishing](/wiki/Wishing "Wishing") for an artifact with half physical damage less desirable, as the Hand of Vecna can be obtained by any character in SLASH'EM's mid-game, and provides hungerless regeneration and cold resistance as well as half physical damage.

## See also

- [damage](/wiki/Damage "Damage")
- [half spell damage](/wiki/Half_spell_damage "Half spell damage")

html:
Half physical damage

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Half physical damage is an extrinsic property in NetHack which halves many types of physical damage. This property is conferred by carrying The Master Key of Thievery or The Orb of Fate.

A more limited form of this effect is bestowed upon priests wearing the Mitre of Holiness, which halves attack damage from major demons, undead, and shapeshifted vampires.

Carrying a second half physical damage artifact does not further reduce damage taken.

Half physical damage applies after the damage reduction from armor class, if any.[1]

Contents

  • 1 Description
  • 2 History
  • 3 SLASH'EM
  • 4 See also
  • 5 References

Description

Half physical damage protects against:

  • ordinary physical damage from a monster attack[2][3][4][5]
  • the geyser monster spell[6]
  • explosion of a gas spore[7][8]
  • fall of a piercer[9]
  • ordinary physical damage from a falling rock trap, bear trap, rust trap (if you are polymorphed into an iron golem), pit, spiked pit, or land mine[10][11]
  • exploding a chest[12]
  • exploding a door or a tin[13]
  • sitting on an iron spike in a spiked pit (not exactly halved)[14]
  • rust damage from exposure to water (if you are polymorphed into an iron golem)[15]
  • crashing to the floor via levitation over a sink[16]
  • hit point loss from being polyformed into an eel out of water[17]
  • maximum energy drain from a foocubus encounter[18]
  • exhaustion from a foocubus encounter[19]
  • hurtling into an obstacle[20]
  • damage from tossing an object upwards[21][22]
  • damage from a returning thrown weapon that you fail to catch[23]
  • damage from a potion of holy water[24] or unholy water[25]
  • quaffing a cursed potion of levitation on a level where you cannot rise[26]
  • damage from a potion of acid[27][28]
  • physical damage from a thrown or wielded potion bottle[29]
  • damage from an attached heavy iron ball[30][31][32]
  • an exploding wand[33]
  • damage from zapping yourself with a wand[34]
  • hitting yourself with a bullwhip[35]
  • hitting yourself with a grappling hook[36]
  • breaking a wand[37]
  • light damage to yourself polymorphed into a gremlin[38]
  • damage from a falling rock or boulder from other causes[39][40][41]
  • hitting your own foot with an axe while trying to free yourself from a bear trap[42]
  • deliberately hitting yourself with a pick-axe[43]
  • hitting a statue or a boulder with an axe (not a pick-axe)[44]
  • splashes from lava[45]
  • squished under a boulder[46]
  • contusion from squeezing into a hole while polymorphed into a huge monster[47]
  • falling down stairs or a ladder[48]
  • charging a ring or wand until it explodes[49][50]
  • blasted by a silver artifact while polymorphed into a silver hater (silver damage only)[51]
  • exploding spellbook[52]
  • casting a spell of force bolt at yourself[53]
  • falling off a steed[54][55]
  • exploding crystal ball[56]
  • poison cloud[57]
  • kicking certain things[58]
  • looting a bag of tricks[59]

Half physical damage does not protect against:[60]

  • damage covered by a resistance, including cold resistance, fire resistance, shock resistance, acid resistance, and magic resistance
    • despite this principle, damage from a potion of acid is covered
  • damage that leaves no mark, including poison and sickness
  • the final stage of total digestion[61]
  • damage from most passive attacks
  • some damage from lava
  • damage from magical explosions such as an alchemic blast or bag of holding
  • damage from divine sources such as being turned
  • damage from an arrow trap[62] or dart trap[63]
  • an antimagic trap does 1d4 more damage to a hero with half physical damage[64]

History

In NetHack 3.4.3 and earlier versions, half physical damage did not protect against many of the uncommon damage effects listed above.

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM adds two more items which give this very useful property - The Hand of Vecna and Gauntlets of Defense. These make wishing for an artifact with half physical damage less desirable, as the Hand of Vecna can be obtained by any character in SLASH'EM's mid-game, and provides hungerless regeneration and cold resistance as well as half physical damage.

See also

  • damage
  • half spell damage
